{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Chi-square test is a statistical test commonly used to compare observed data with data we would expect to obtain according to a specific hypothesis. It is used when dealing with numbers or data that can be categorized, thus it is used for qualitative data. It does not measure quantitative data. It also does not specifically measure data between two proportions, but rather the distribution of categorical data.", "answer_choice": "A"}
